discourse_list.title: Ping a ring from a post

content.content: Is it possible to ping a ring from a post? E.g. I think it would make sense to ping the wallet ring about this EIP: Temporal Replay Protection But I do not see a way currently to do so - the only way I see is making a post linking to the post above with the category wallet ring. But this does not feel right.

We may be able to do this via “user groups”, I will open it up when I get a chance. It may require someone to look after the group membership in this Discourse setup though.   github.com/ethereum-magicians/scrolls      Issue: Maintaining user groups for Rings on the FEM Forum  	 	opened by jpitts 	on 2019-01-08 	 	 	  This is for a @ligi suggestion for messaging members of a particular ring inside of FEM Forum messages. https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/ping-a-ring-from-a-post/2356   	forum

Group membership can be set so anyone can join or remove themselves. The @council-volunteers is an example of a group that people can add / remove to on their own – and I’m actually pinging 22 people by @-mentioning that  So @ligi just ask for what group you want created and it should solve what you want to do.

boris:  So @ligi just ask for what group you want created and it should solve what you want to do.   I wanted to ping all wallet-developers. So a group for the wallet developers ring would be nice. But perhaps we should make it more general and have groups for all rings.
Yes, see Github issue #14 where I first suggested it
